alert.note: Alert for Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued February 05 at 2:56AM PST until February 05 at 9:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT NOW IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM PST THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Sneaker waves possible. * WHERE...In Washington, South Washington Coast. In Oregon, Central Oregon Coast and North Oregon Coast. * WHEN...From 7 AM PST this morning through this evening. * IMPACTS...Waves can run up significantly farther on a beach than normal, including over rocks and jetties. Sneaker waves can suddenly knock people off of their feet and quickly pull them into the frigid ocean which may lead to serious injury or drowning.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water to avoid hazardous swimming conditions. A Beach Hazards Statement is issued when sneaker waves create potentially life-threatening conditions in the surf zone. Caution should be used when in or near the water. Always keep an eye on the waves, and be especially watchful of children.

area.areaDesc: Central Oregon Coast; North Oregon Coast
